page.title: 05SHOPPING FOR FOOD
page.content: At a{supermarket,}away from the city centre, but in a built up area, the manager was interviewed by a group of children. There are more women staff than men, some work part_time and generally there would be about twenty on the shop floor and ten behind the scenes. The manager decides what has to be ordered but Head office decides on the prices, not necessarily the same as in the other supermarkets in the same chain. There are daily deliveries to the shop which has its own named brands as well as many other popular brands. Some customers were questioned as they entered the shop. Most of them lived close by and bought mainly English food. Other children went to a small shop in the same area, run solely by an Asian family. AS well as English food the owner keeps a large stock of Asian food.
